intro: Chaetolepis saturaeioides, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
